examType: Entrance Exam for Medical PG Courses
conductingBody: National Board of Examinations in Medical Sciences (NBEMS)
eligibility: Candidates must possess an MBBS degree or provisional MBBS pass certificate as per the Indian Medical Council Act, have an MBBS registration certificate issued by the Indian or state medical council, and have completed or will be completing one year of internship. Foreign medical graduates must qualify the Medical Council of India Screening Test and be registered with the Indian or state medical council, with one year of internship completed or to be completed. Foreign nationals must have registration from their country of qualification; MCI registration is not compulsory, but temporary registration may be granted on payment of application fees.[2]

faqs.question: What is the duration and format of NEET PG?
faqs.answer: NEET PG is a computer-based test of 3 hours and 30 minutes duration, comprising 300 questions in a single section. Candidates answer questions on a computer at a designated test center.[1]
